metadata.Title: CVE-2019-12493 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
A stack-based buffer over-read exists in PostScriptFunction::transform in Function.cc in Xpdf 4.01.01 because GfxSeparationColorSpace and GfxDeviceNColorSpace mishandle tint transform functions. It can, for example, be triggered by sending a crafted PDF document to the pdftops tool. It might allow an attacker to cause Denial of Service or leak memory data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12493` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
libpoppler-cpp0v5 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
libpoppler97 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
poppler-utils - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> xpdf in koffice is 2.0 mdeslaur> as of 2022-01-05, xpdf commit not available. ebarretto> Marking emscripten ignored as poppler code is only for test/example. since 0.5.12-1 libextractor does not use xpdf anymore. xpdf in Debian uses poppler, which is not affected or fixed

criterions.comment: poppler package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.76.1-0ubuntu3').
texlive-bin package in focal is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
